alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 2:31PM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in areas below 10000 feet. Higher peaks above 10000 feet can see higher amounts greater than a foot. Southern parts of the range will see less snow, with accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West and Wind River Mountains East. * WHEN...From 6 PM Wednesday to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, with heaviest snowfall during the morning and afternoon Thursday. Winds will be gusty at times Wednesday, with gusts of 50 mph or more possible, over South Pass, leading to areas of blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hunters and others heading into the backcountry should prepare for wet and cold conditions. Heavy, wet snow could make travel difficult on unpaved mountain roads, especially above 8,000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West
